oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Mess kit of Thomas Cleve Maness
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: This mess kit belonged to Pvt. Thomas Cleve Maness, Btry. B, 318th FA a farmer from Beech Bluff, Tennessee. Also called a "meat can" by the Army, it is of the shallow first pattern and made of aluminum with a steel handle. The end of the handle is marked "U S /LF & C / 1917." The steel bladed, cast aluminum handled knife is marked "LF & C / 1917." Cleves served in the army from August 8, 1918 until June 11, 1919.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
